title: Active@ File Recovery Ultimate 14.5.0.1
description:
---------------------------------------------------
Active@ File Recovery Ultimate 14.5.0.1
---------------------------------------------------

Efficient & easy to use recovery utility for deleted, damaged or lost files, even if your PC doesn't boot

Active@ File Recovery for Windows provides the ability to effectively detect and recover files and disks lost due to accidental deletion, disk formatting, virus and other reasons.

The Professional package also includes integrated Active@ Disk Editor (or Hex Viewer - a utility for low-level data inspection), Virtual RAID reconstructor, being able to recover damaged RAID disk arrays, and File Organizer needed to re-organize and rename files detected by their signatures.

The Ultimate edition extends the Professional package with Active@ Boot Disk Lite: an ISO image that you can use to create a bootable CD/DVD or USB with a lightweight version of Windows 8Ã¢â€žÂ¢(WinPE 5.1) or Linux (OpenSUSE 13) running in RAM. It is the only way to recover your data when your system is not bootable and you cannot attach the corrupted Hard Disk Drive to another machine. Boot Disk & LiveCD can boot the latest UEFI secure boot systems & legacy BIOS PC.

---------------------------------------------------
What's new in version 14.5:
---------------------------------------------------
- More pre-defined file signatures recognition: OpenOffice Spreadsheet *.ODS. Database *.ODB, Formula *.ODF, Graphic *.ODG and Presentation *.ODP;
- Improved Linux Ext2Ext3Ext4 file systems scanning performance;
- Included the latest Active@ Disk Editor 6;
- Active@ Boot Disk switched to WinPE 5.1 64-bit (x64) base which performs faster & optimizes RAM usage;
- Active@ Boot Disk now being able to boot the latest UEFI Secure Boot systems.

---------------------------------------------------
System Requirements
---------------------------------------------------
Windows 8
Windows 7
Windows Vista
Windows Server 2008
Windows Server 2003
Windows XP
FAT/FAT32, NTFS/NTFS5, HFS+, Ext2/Ext3fs, exFAT, Ext4fs (Linux), UFS (FreeBSD UNIX)
